Description: Quality control tool for high throughput raw sequence data
Features: Contains quality reports and gives pass/fail results for the following checks: Per base sequence quality, Per sequence quality scores, Per base sequence content, Per base GC content, Per sequence GC content, Per base N content, Sequence Length Distribution, Sequence Duplication Levels, Overrepresented sequences, Kmer Contenthas a GUI
Strength: Easy to use; Provide visualization in the HTML report; Can be used on Illumina, PacBio, 454 reads.

Description: The FASTX-Toolkit is a collection of command line tools for Short-Reads FASTA/FASTQ files preprocessing.
Features: Besides "fastx_trimmer" in this toolkit, there are multiple tools and commands for processing fastq/fasta files
Strength: Can also be integrated and used on the web-based platform Galaxy.
Limitation: Last updated in 2010. {"value": "Be ware of the older base quality encoding. ", "link" : "https://wikis.utexas.edu/display/bioiteam/FASTQ+Manipulation+Tools" }

Description: A flexible read trimming tool for Illumina NGS data
Features: Can trim adaptor sequences, remove low-quality reads and bases.
Strength: It is designed as more pair-aware for paired-end data. The authors found trimmomatic ran faster than cutadapt and FASTX-Toolkit.  ({"value":"Trimmomatic","link":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4103590/"})

Description: Cutadapt finds and removes adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and other types of unwanted sequence from your high-throughput sequencing reads.
Features: Trims adaptors;
Strength: Supports 454, Illumina and SOLiD (colour space) data.

Description: Tool for mapping short reads and uses the idea of layered seed structures similar to multiple filtration.
Features: Full use of quality scores in mapping, paired-end reads mapping, map bisulfite sequencing reads to ordinary reference genome.
Strength: Mapping reads using quality scores in a refined way. Monitoring ambiguous mapping locations.

Description: BS Seeker transforms the genome into a three-letter alphabet and then uses Bowtie for alignment.
Features: Works with bisulfite reads generated from the two different existing experimental protocols, use of sequence tags to reduce mapping ambiguity, post-processing of alignments.
Strength: Considerably faster than RMAP and BSMAP.

Description: Bismark performs mapping and methylation calling in a single step.
Features: Bisulfite mapping and methylation calling in one single step. Supports single-end and paired-end read alignments. Supports ungapped and gapped alignments. Alignment seed length, number of mismatches etc. are adjustable. Output discriminates between cytosine methylation in�CpG,�CHG�and�CHH�context.
Strength: Supports paired-end reads and variable read length.
Limitation: Increased runtime compared to other tools due to lower probability of reporting non-unique alignments.
Platform requirement: Perl, Bowtie or Bowtie 2, recommended machine: at least 5 cores + >16GB RAM

Description: Alignment tool tailored for Reduced representation bisulfite sequencing (RRBS) data.
Features: read length up to 144 nt, allow up to 15 mismatches, gap size up to 3 bp, supports single-end and paired-end mapping, supports multi-thread mapping, supports both "Lister protocol" (sequence 2 forward strands only) and "Cokus protocol" (sequence all 4 bisulfite converted strands).
Strength: Offers better runtime performance compared to other tools, maintaining comparable mapping accuracy.

Description: General purpose bisulfite sequencing alignment tool.
Features: Integrates novel Mismatch Counting, List Filtering, Mismatch Stage Filtering and Fast Mapping onto Two Indexes components to improve unique mapping rate, speed and precision.
Strength: Faster and more accurate than BSMAP, BS-Seeker, Bismark.

Description: Map short reads from ILLUMINA, SOLiD and Roche-454 technology.
Features: Fast gapped and ungapped alignment onto a reference sequence, uses a filter based on precomputed short-word alignments, final alignment by dynamic programming.
Strength: Uses a pre-computed score table for faster mapping.

Description: Alignment, quality control and analysis pipeline for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: Unbiased read alignment step, computation of quality assessment metrics, local averaging to improve precision, and detect DMRs considering biological variability.
Strength: Shown to work well for even low coverage data and also handles biological replicates in the analysis.
Limitation: Assumes that the true methylation profile is smooth, therefore the tool might not be suitable to detect single CpGs.

Description: Alignment, quality control and analysis pipeline for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: Compiles quality assessment measures based on stratifying methylation estimates by read position.
Strength: Quality assessment plot for each uniquely aligned read.

Description: Performs simple quality control before differential methylation analysis
Features: Sample-wise coverage distributions.
Strength: Convenient R functions for statistics and plots.
Limitation: Only few options available for quality control.

Description: A Streamlined Analysis and Annotation Pipeline for RRBS data.
Features: Read quality check, adapter trimming, alignment, methylation data extraction, annotation, reporting, and visualization. Handles both single-end and paired-end reads.
Strength: Integrated all steps for CpG methylation analysis into one pipeline, where the user starts with sequenced reads and finally gets a CpG methylation report.

Description: Bismark performs mapping of bisulfite treated sequencing reads and methylation calling in a single step.
Features: Bisulfite mapping and methylation calling in one single step. Supports single-end and paired-end read alignments. Supports ungapped and gapped alignments. Alignment seed length, number of mismatches etc. are adjustable. Output discriminates between cytosine methylation in�CpG,�CHG�and�CHH�context.
Strength: Supports paired-end reads and variable read length.
Limitation: Increased runtime compared to other tools due to lower probability of reporting non-unique alignments.
Platform requirement: Perl, Bowtie or Bowtie 2, recommended machine: at least 5 cores + >16GB RAM

Description: Integrative Genomics Viewer is a popular visualization tool for viewing large heterogeneous genomics datasets.
Features: Display of sample attributes such as clinical and phenotypic data, interactive exploration of data using click and drag to pan the view and double-click to zoom into a region, real-time interaction at all scales of genome resolution.
Strength: Can integrate multiple types of datasets, including methylation data. Offers smooth loading at different resolutions.

Description: Exploratory analysis and visualization of bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: Imports DNA methylation sequences, aligns and performs quality control comparison. Features: lollipop visualization, co-occurrence display of methylation of neighbouring and distant CpG sites, summary statistics on methylation status, clustering and correspondence analysis.
Strength: The authors provide a convenient R package for analysis and visualization. Performs quality control as well in one of the steps.

Description: The tool mainly performs differential methylation analysis, aids in sample clustering, annotation and visualization.
Features:
Coverage statistics,
Methylation statistics,
Sample correlation and clustering,
Differential methylation analysis,
Feature annotation and accessor/coercion functions, 
Multiple visualization options,
Regional and tiling windows analysis,
Reading methylation calls directly from [Bismark(Bowtie/Bowtie2],
Batch effect control,
Multithreading support, 
Coercion to objects from Bioconductor package GenomicRanges,
Reading methylation percentage data from generic text files.
Strength: Provides a comprehensive and flexible R package for differential methylation analysis.

Description: Alignment, quality control and analysis pipeline for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: Find regions that show consistent differences even when considering biological variation.
Strength: Shown to work well for even low coverage data and also handles biological replicates in the analysis.
Limitation: Assumes that the true methylation profile is smooth, therefore the tool might not be suitable to detect single CpGs.

Description: An approach to detect significantly differentially methylated regions (DMR) accounting for spatial dependence.
Features: Detection of CpG clusters, smoothing methylation data within CpG clusters, model and test group effect for each CpG site within CpG clusters, apply hierarchical testing procedure to get DMR boundaries.
Strength: Uses a hierarchical procedure for testing target regions, leading to a more powerful approach than BSmooth and methylKit.
Limitation: The method is particularly suited for targeted sequencing approaches such as RRBS. Analysis is limited for whole-genome sequencing data.

Description: Differential methylation analysis
Features: The tool produces statistically significant DMRs and connects to nearest genes and CpGs.
Strength: The method also describes differentially methylated fragments (DMF) based on MspI fragments.

Description: The tool mainly performs differential methylation analysis, aids in sample clustering, annotation and visualization.
Features:
Coverage statistics,
Methylation statistics,
Sample correlation and clustering,
Differential methylation analysis,
Feature annotation and accessor/coercion functions, 
Multiple visualization options,

Reading methylation calls directly from [Bismark(Bowtie/Bowtie2],
Batch effect control,
Multithreading support, 
Coercion to objects from Bioconductor package GenomicRanges,
Reading methylation percentage data from generic text files.
Strength: Provides a comprehensive and flexible R package for differential methylation analysis; Calls differential methylated CpGs.s
